meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x goes Native
meta.summary: This blog post introduces native image generation of Vert.x applications with GraalVM. Generated executables can be run without a JVM.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.5.2
meta.summary: We have just released Vert.x 3.5.2, a bug fix release of Vert.x 3.5.x.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x RabbitMQ client gets a new consumer API!
meta.summary: In this blog post, we present the new consumer API of the RabbitMQ client that will be released with Eclipse Vert.x 3.6.0.

meta.title: Unit and Integration Tests
meta.summary: Let’s refresh our mind about what we developed so far in the introduction to vert.x series. We forgot an important task. We didn’t test the API.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Vert.x featuring Continuous Delivery with Jenkins and Ansible
meta.summary: This blog entry describes an approach to adopt Continuous Delivery for Vert.x applications using Jenkins and Ansible by taking advantage of the Jenkins Job DSL and Ansible plugins.
